header.title: 🇺🇸 San Diego to San Francisco Coastal Road Trip
header.subtitle: October 29 – November 8, 2025

rows: Full day exploring San Diego (Balboa Park, La Jolla, Old Town)
Explore Coronado Island, San Diego Zoo, and Gaslamp Quarter
Scenic coastal drive via PCH with stops at Dana Point, Malibu
Explore Stearns Wharf, Santa Barbara Mission, State Street
Stops at Solvang and Pismo Beach en route
Visit Morro Bay, Hearst Castle, Elephant Seal Beach
Explore McWay Falls, Pfeiffer Beach, Bixby Bridge
Stops at Carmel-by-the-Sea, Monterey, Santa Cruz
Explore Golden Gate Bridge, Alcatraz, Fisherman’s Wharf
Morning exploration or relaxation before flight to Philly

sections.heading: San Diego, CA (Oct 29 – Oct 31)
paragraphs: Nicknamed “America’s Finest City”, San Diego blends 70 miles of beaches with Spanish-Colonial history, world-class museums and a booming craft-beer scene.
Weather in early November: Warm afternoons ~70 °F; cool nights ~56 °F; rare rain.

callouts.title: Interesting facts
items: Home to the largest urban cultural park in the U.S. — Balboa Park.
Has over 70 miles of beautiful coastline and beaches.
One of the best year-round climates in the country.

callouts.title: Sights & Experiences
items: Balboa Park – Museums, gardens, and the famous San Diego Zoo.
San Diego Zoo – World-renowned for animal conservation.
La Jolla Cove – Perfect for scenic views and sea lions.

callouts.title: Food Highlights
items: Try fish tacos at Oscar’s Mexican Seafood.
Visit Little Italy for pasta and gelato.
Enjoy sunset drinks at George’s at the Cove in La Jolla.

callouts.title: Practical Tips
items: Use public transit or ride-share in the downtown area.
Bring layers — it cools down at night.
Parking in La Jolla can be tricky — go early.

sections.heading: Santa Barbara, CA (Nov 1 – Nov 3)
paragraphs: Santa Barbara is known as the 'American Riviera' for its Mediterranean-like climate and picturesque coastline.
This coastal gem is ideal for a relaxing stay filled with Spanish architecture, beaches, and fine wine.
listItems: Old Mission Santa Barbara – A historic Spanish mission with beautiful architecture and gardens.
Stearns Wharf – Great for seafood, shops, and ocean views.
Santa Ynez Valley – A short drive away and home to some of California’s best wineries.

callouts.title: Interesting facts
items: Nicknamed the ‘American Riviera’ for its Mediterranean climate and style.
Famous for its Spanish Colonial Revival architecture.
Home to over 200 wineries in nearby valleys.

callouts.title: Sights & Experiences
items: Stearns Wharf – Great for seafood and ocean views.
Santa Barbara Mission – A landmark of California history.
State Street – Central hub for dining and shopping.

callouts.title: Food Highlights
items: Try the seafood at Brophy Bros. on the Wharf.
Tacos at Lilly’s Taqueria are a local favorite.
Don’t miss McConnell’s Fine Ice Cream.

callouts.title: Practical Tips
items: Book wine tours to Santa Ynez Valley in advance.
Walk or bike along Cabrillo Blvd. for ocean views.
Stay centrally for easy walkability.

sections.heading: San Luis Obispo, CA (Nov 3 – Nov 4)
paragraphs: San Luis Obispo, or SLO, is a laid-back Central Coast town rich with history, culture, and wine.
It's known for its charming downtown, mission, and the famously quirky Bubblegum Alley.
listItems: Mission San Luis Obispo – One of California’s original Spanish missions.
Bubblegum Alley – A must-see (and Instagram) oddity.
Edna Valley – Excellent local wine tasting region just outside of town.

callouts.title: Interesting facts
items: Often called the ‘Happiest City in America’.
Home to one of California’s oldest missions.
Bubblegum Alley is covered in thousands of pieces of gum.

callouts.title: Sights & Experiences
items: Mission San Luis Obispo – A peaceful historic site.
Bubblegum Alley – Weird but wonderful photo stop.
Thursday Night Farmers’ Market – A local tradition with food and music.

callouts.title: Food Highlights
items: Big Sky Café for fresh, healthy meals.
Firestone Grill for a tri-tip sandwich.
Enjoy wine tasting in Edna Valley.

callouts.title: Practical Tips
items: Park once and explore downtown on foot.
Consider a day trip to Morro Bay.
Plan dinner early — many restaurants close by 9 PM.

sections.heading: Big Sur, CA (Nov 4 – Nov 6)
paragraphs: Big Sur is a dramatic stretch of California's central coast where the Santa Lucia Mountains rise abruptly from the Pacific Ocean.
Known for its scenic driving, this region is perfect for outdoor enthusiasts and landscape lovers alike.
listItems: Julia Pfeiffer Burns State Park – Home to McWay Falls, a waterfall dropping into the ocean.
Bixby Creek Bridge – One of the most photographed bridges in California.
Pfeiffer Beach – Stunning views and purple sand.

callouts.title: Interesting facts
items: Stretches over 90 miles of rugged California coast.
Home to the iconic Bixby Creek Bridge.
One of the most scenic drives in the U.S.

callouts.title: Sights & Experiences
items: McWay Falls – Waterfall cascading onto a beach.
Bixby Creek Bridge – Stunning photo spot.
Pfeiffer Beach – Known for purple sand and sea stacks.

callouts.title: Food Highlights
items: Nepenthe – Famous cliffside restaurant with views.
Big Sur Bakery – Cozy and popular breakfast/lunch stop.
Grab picnic supplies before entering — food is limited.

callouts.title: Practical Tips
items: Cell service is very limited — download maps offline.
Gas up before entering Big Sur.
Start early to beat traffic and maximize daylight.

sections.heading: San Francisco, CA (Nov 6 – Nov 8)
paragraphs: San Francisco is a cultural and technological hub, known for its rolling hills, iconic landmarks, and historic neighborhoods.
Perfect for walking, ferry rides, and scenic views of the Bay.
listItems: Alcatraz Island – A fascinating tour of the former prison with views of the Bay.
Golden Gate Bridge – Walk, bike, or drive this iconic span.
Fisherman’s Wharf & Pier 39 – Seafood, sea lions, and street performances.

callouts.title: Interesting facts
items: Built on 43 hills — bring your walking shoes.
Home to the oldest Chinatown in North America.
Fog is common — locals call it ‘Karl the Fog’.

callouts.title: Sights & Experiences
items: Golden Gate Bridge – Walk or bike for the full experience.
Alcatraz Island – Book ferry tours early.
Cable Cars – A fun way to explore steep streets.

callouts.title: Food Highlights
items: Try clam chowder in a sourdough bowl at Boudin.
Visit Chinatown for dim sum.
Explore the Ferry Building for gourmet food vendors.

callouts.title: Practical Tips
items: Layered clothing is a must — weather changes fast.
Avoid driving — parking is scarce and expensive.
Use the MUNI pass for cable cars and buses.
